page.title: 02THE TOWN OF CHERTSEY
page.content: Chertsey is a small town with two shopping streets - Guildford Street and Windsor Street. Surrounding these is a residential area which stretches as far as the railway in the south and the motorway in the north. There is a new library in Eastworth Road opposite the new Chertsey Hall. New housing and offices are also to be found in this part of Chertsey. The older buildings including the Town Hall, St. Peter's Church and the Museum, centre around Windsor Street and London Street which leads to Chertsey Bridge. The bridge celebrated its two hundreth anniversary in l985. The Sainsbury Shopping Centre was opened in l981 by Councillor John Walbridge, Mayor of Runnymede and has a variety of small shops in an arcade as well as a large supermarket.
